pr_title: Use the venv_builder tool to prepare a Python virtual environment

timeline.message: Set Python as the SDK for modules
Detect and invoke the venv_builder tool when importing a Pants project with Python targets

timeline.author: tpasternak

replies.bodyText:
The venv_builder tool supports only one target selector (which, however, can be as general as ::), so I think this way of selecting the "main" target is an acceptable compromise for now.
P.S. This problem is fixed in pull request #598.
replies.author: odisseus

timeline.bodyText:
I think we could use com.twitter.intellij.pants.bsp.PantsTargetAddress class here instead of String for selector
(and it could be moved from bsp package)
timeline.author: tpasternak

replies.bodyText: What is the conceptual difference between com.twitter.intellij.pants.bsp.PantsTargetAddress and com.twitter.intellij.pants.model.PantsTargetAddress?
replies.author: odisseus

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't the target name be configurable?
timeline.author: tpasternak

replies.bodyText:
The target name is always the same. If your project doesn't have this exact target, you probably can't use the venv_builder tool anyway.  Therefore, I think it is permissible to hardcode this target name.
However, the tool itself doesn't seem to contain any special logic. In the future, we might want to get that tool released to the public, or perhaps create a similar one.
replies.author: odisseus
